headline.main: Obama and Boehner Talk Deficits at the White House
headline.print_headline: Obama and Boehner Meet, Raising Hopes

docs.abstract: President Obama and Speaker John A. Boehner met privately as a top Republican senator said acceding on tax rates for high earners might shift attention to entitlements.

docs.lead_paragraph: As part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, the new levies, which take effect in January, include an increase in the payroll tax on wages and a tax on investment income.

headline.main: New Taxes to Take Effect to Fund Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: New Taxes to Take Effect to Fund Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Taxes adopted as part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act take effect in January, and include an increase in payroll tax on wages and a tax on investment income.
docs.snippet: As part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, the new levies, which take effect in January, include an increase in the payroll tax on wages and a tax on investment income.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reputation.com is building a business around helping people store personal data about themselves as a way to manage their online reputations.

headline.main: A Vault for Taking Charge of Your Online Life

docs.abstract: Reputation.com is building a data vault service that collects data about consumers' marketing preferences and gives them option to share information on limited basis with certain companies in exchange for coupons or other perks; company has several hundred thousands paying customers and is at forefront of nascent industry called 'personal identity management.' (Series: You For Sale)
docs.snippet: Reputation.com is building a business around helping people store personal data about themselves as a way to manage their online reputations.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite a stroke left her partially paralyzed, Marianela Toro has kept her spirits high, with the help of a sister and a nephew.

headline.seo: After Stroke, Living in a Home Filled With Bickering, and Love
headline.main: After Stroke, Living in a Home Filled With Bickering, and Love
headline.print_headline: After a Stroke, Living in a Bronx Apartment Filled With Bickering, Pranks and Love

docs.abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York helps Marianela Toro of the Bronx, who is recovering from a paralyzing stroke, pay her back rent.
docs.snippet: Despite a stroke left her partially paralyzed, Marianela Toro has kept her spirits high, with the help of a sister and a nephew.

docs.lead_paragraph: The amount, which requires Congressional approval, is less than what regional leaders had requested for Hurricane Sandy relief but more than the administration had estimated just a few days ago.

headline.main: Obama Asking Congress for $60.4 Billion to Help States Recover From Storm
headline.print_headline: Obama Asking Congress for $60.4 Billion to Help States Recover From Storm

docs.abstract: Pres Obama proposes a $60.4 billion emergency spending bill on to finance recovery efforts in areas pummeled by Hurricane Sandy, a sum that White House officials called a 'robust' investment in the region but that was far less than what the states had requested; spending plan would pay for most, but not all, of the $82 billion in damage identified by the governors of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.
docs.snippet: The amount, which requires Congressional approval, is less than what regional leaders had requested for Hurricane Sandy relief but more than the administration had estimated just a few days ago.

byline.original: By RAYMOND HERNANDEZ and PETER BAKER
